Package org.engine.graphics

Class Renderer

java.lang.Object
org.engine.graphics.Renderer
public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
Handles the creation of the game frame, the initialization of some related OpenGL objects and provides useful functions for rendering graphics onto the screen

      See Also:

    • unitsWide

      public static int unitsWide
      Viewport dimensions and scale, useful for rendering objects to the screen. They are not final since they are calculated at runtime based on the screen resolution, or in case the game window changed it's dimensions.

    • unitsHigh

      public static int unitsHigh
      Viewport dimensions and scale, useful for rendering objects to the screen. They are not final since they are calculated at runtime based on the screen resolution, or in case the game window changed it's dimensions.

    • scale

      public static int scale
      Viewport dimensions and scale, useful for rendering objects to the screen. They are not final since they are calculated at runtime based on the screen resolution, or in case the game window changed it's dimensions.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static void init() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Initializes the window and some OpenGL objects
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - fatal error, prints stack trace and exits,

    • setRotation

      public static void setRotation​(float r)
      Sets the rotation of the renderer relative to the screen. Should be reset (set back to 0) after every use since the last value set carries over to all future renderings
      Parameters:
      r - rotation in degrees

    • fillRect

      public static void fillRect​(float x, float y, float width, float height)
      Draws a solid fill rectangle with it's "center" (intersection of diagonals) at the given coordinates x,y and specified width/height
      Parameters:
      x - horizontal coordinate of the "center"
      y - vertical coordinate of the "center"
      width - full width of the rectangle being drawn
      height - full height of the rectangle being drawn

    • drawImage

      public static void drawImage​(ImageResource image, float width, float height, float x, float y, boolean flip)
      Draws a given Image Resource object to the screen, used for pretty much everything
      Parameters:
      image - Image resource (retrieved from an objects Animations)
      width - width of the image (should be used with getters from the image object rather than hardcoded)
      height - height of the image
      x - coordinate of the image's centre
      y - ditto
      flip - horizontal flip

    • loadFont

      private static void loadFont()

    • drawText

      public static void drawText​(java.lang.String text, short textSize, int x, int y, float r, float g, float b, float a)
      TODO Add support for text boxes/paragraphs Draws a given string on the screen centered ath the given x,y coordinates
      Parameters:
      text - text to be rendered
      textSize - size of then in-game font (chosen between 3 sizes given as public finals)
      x - horizontal coordinate
      y - vertical coordinate
      r - red color value(0 to 1f)
      g - green color value(0 to 1f)
      b - blue color value(0 to 1f)
      a - alpha color value(0 to 1f)

    • setColor

      public static void setColor​(float r, float g, float b, float a)
      Sets rendering color, all values should be maxed out for rendering properly coloured images
      Parameters:
      r - red value (0f to 1f)
      g - green value (0f to 1f)
      b - blue value (0f to 1f)
      a - alpha aka transparency (0f to 1f) (0 = invisible, 1 = opaque) If any of the parameters are outside of the allow range, the function sets the respective value to 0 or 1, depending on whether the argument was below 0 or above 1

    • IsoCoordinates

      public static int[] IsoCoordinates​(double x, double y)
      Computes the isometric coordinates from the regular x/y coordinates
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate on the x axis
      y - coordinate on the y axis
      Returns:
      returns an integer array of length 2 containing the isometric x and isometric y respectively in that order

    • isInRectangle

      public static boolean isInRectangle​(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float width, float height)
      Checks whether the given point with coordinates x1,y1 is inside of the rectangle with "centre" (intersection of diagonals) at x2,y2 and with given width and height
      Parameters:
      x1 - horizontal coordinate of the point in question
      y1 - vertical coordinate of the point in question
      x2 - horizontal coordinate of the rectangle (its intersection of diagonals)
      y2 - vertical coordinate of the rectangle (its intersection of diagonals)
      width - full width of the rectangle
      height - full height of the rectangle

    • render

      public static void render()
      Displays the window and all it's contents

    • getWindowWidth

      public static int getWindowWidth()
      Fetches the current width of the window
      Returns:
      width of the window as an integer

    • getWindowHeight

      public static int getWindowHeight()
      Fetches the current height of the window
      Returns:
      height of the window as an integer

    • getProfile

      public static com.jogamp.opengl.GLProfile getProfile()
      Returns the current GLProfile object which holds some useful graphics-related information
      Returns:
      GLProfile object created during initialization
